column4: Hey everyone, can someone help me with this networking problem?
Wait, I made a thread. I'll post it up.
That's the link to the thread I made.

I'm guessing your router/firewall is set at 223.0.0.1, and your wireless AP is set at 223.0.0.2? if that's the case, then theres a collision going on with your IP addresses. manually set a static IP address on the ps3
The PS3's IP address is set to 223.0.0.2
The PS3's IP address is set to 223.0.0.2
yep, it's colliding with your wireless access point, those usually take an IP address one spot above the default gateway
change it to 223.0.0.3 or 4 or what have you
mooshimuushi or whatever your computer or any other devices on your network are set to
When I restart the computer. The wireless will still not work.
mooshimuushi: see if that works, if not, then idk.
and make sure your default gateway/subnet masks/dns is set right
